data.benefits: This scheme provides collateral free loan upto Rs.20 lakhs within 36 months through assistance from MUDRA.
data.eligibility: All existing micro enterprise sector in manufacturing, service, processing, sector or trading including activities allied to agriculture are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. The applicants may be required to have the necessary experience or skills or knowledge to carry out the proposed activity. 
  2. The prospective borrower should not be defaulter in any bank or any financial institution and should have a satisfactory credit track record. 
  3. The Mudra loan limit to Rs 20 lakh for entrepreneurs who have repaid previous loans under the ‘Tarun’ category.
data.beneficiaries: All existing micro enterprise sector in manufacturing, service, processing, sector or trading including activities allied to agriculture are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. The applicants may be required to have the necessary experience or skills or knowledge to carry out the proposed activity. 
  2. The prospective borrower should not be defaulter in any bank or any financial institution and should have a satisfactory credit track record. 
  3. The Mudra loan limit to Rs 20 lakh for entrepreneurs who have repaid previous loans under the ‘Tarun’ category.
data.nodal_agency: Micro Units Development and Refinance Agency Ltd. [MUDRA]
data.context: This scheme is introduced to provide affordable credit to the micro enterprises engaged in trading, manufacturing and service sectors, including agricultural activities.
data.objective: The main aim is to offer loans of up to Rs.20 lakh to micro enterprises through commercial banks, small finance banks, MFIs, RRBs and NBFCs.
data.description:
Scheme provides collateral free loan in the following categories: 

  • Shishu : Up to Rs. 50000 
  • Kishore : Above Rs 50,000 to Rs 5 lakh 
  • Tarun : Above Rs 5 lakh to Rs 10 lakh* 

*Budget 2024 has proposed to increase the Mudra loan limit to Rs 20 lakh for entrepreneurs who have repaid previous loans under the ‘Tarun’ category. 

MUDRA Card benefit : 

  • MUDRA Card is a RuPay debit card, which offers working capital loan in the form of an overdraft facility. 
  • The card allows multiple withdrawals and credits, digitalizing transactions and creating credit history for the borrower.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the link : https://pmmydata.mudra.org.in/##
data.funding_facilitator: Commercial Banks, RRBs, Small Finance Banks, Cooperative Banks, MFIs and NBFCs.
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the loan after the approval of the concerned authority.
data.additional_info:
• Banks may consider charging of upfront fee as per their internal guidelines. 
  • The upfront fee/processing charges for Shishu loans (Covering loans upto Rs. 50,000/-) are waived by most Banks. 
  • Sectors included : Shopkeepers, fruits / vegetable vendors, truck operators, food-service units, repair shops, machine operators, small industries, artisans, food processors and others.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Establishment proof of Concerned Entity 
2. Identity Proof 
3. Address proof 
4. Credit report 
5. Income proof  
6. Proof of Business existence 
7. Clearance Certificate (if applicable) 
8. Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) 
9. Other KYC Documents
